name: select

passthrough.description:
HTML attributes that are not explicitly supported by cfselect. If you specify an attribute and 
		its value, the attribute and its value are passed to the HTML code that is generated for the cfselect 
		tag.

size.description: Number of entries in the drop-down list.

message.description: Message that displays if required = 'Yes' and no selection is made.

name.description: Name of the form you are creating.

required.description:
Yes or No. If Yes, a list element must be selected when the form is submitted, and the size of 
		the drop-down list must be at least two. Default is No.

display.description: The query column displayed. Defaults to the value of value. Used with the query attribute.

selected.description: A value matching at least one entry in value to preselect the entry in the drop-down list box.

casesensitive.description: is compare for selected case sensitive or not

onerror.description: The name of a valid JavaScript function to execute in the event of a failed validation.

multiple.description:
Yes or No. Yes permits selection of multiple elements in the drop-down list box. The default 
		is No.

value.description: The query column value for the list element. Used with the query attribute.

query.description: Name of the query to be used to populate the drop-down list box.

description:
Used inside cfform, cfselect lets you construct a drop-down list box form control. You can 
  populate the drop-down list box from a query, or using the option tag. Use option elements to populate 
  lists. The syntax for the option tag is the same as for its HTML counterpart.
